revised_title: Protective Antigens in Rodent and Human Bloodstage Malaria
tldr: This article discusses the identification and analysis of protective antigens in rodent and human bloodstage malaria parasites. The authors describe the characterization of antigens from Plasmodium yoelii and P. falciparum, which may play a role in inducing protective immunity in the host. They also explore the potential use of these antigens in developing a vaccine against falciparum malaria.
